snippet: Managers of three of the better-performing mutual funds in the first quarter succeeded by buying stocks shunned by others, or by holding investments longer.
abstract: Managers of three of the better-performing mutual funds, including Thomas T Soviero of Fidelity Convertible Securities, Andrew W Massie of Ivy Cundill Global Value, and Christopher C Arbuthnot of John Hancock Global Opportunities, are unafraid to go against popular opinion and seek stocks that others are shunning.
lead_paragraph: Managers of three of the better-performing mutual funds in the first quarter succeeded by buying stocks shunned by others, or by holding investments longer.

headline.seo: Three Mutual Fund Managers Profit From Paths Less Traveled
headline.main: Finding Big Profits Along the Roads Less Traveled
headline.print_headline: Finding Big Profits Along the Roads Less Traveled
